member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.NodeDifferences
member.summary: Constant for the name of the root node for the output in text format. When using, prefix with the 'Tag' constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.Tag
member.summary: Constant for the prefix which indicates xml differences.
member.remarks: The underscore character is used as a separator because it is an allowed character in a node name.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.ChangeBegin
member.summary: Constant to indicate the start of a changed value statement. When using, prefix with the 'Tag' constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.ChangeTo
member.summary: Constant to indicate the middle ('To' portion) of a changed value statement.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.ChangeEnd
member.summary: Constant to indicate the end of a changed value statement.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.AttributeAddedBegin
member.summary: Constant to indicate the start of the name of an added attribute. When using, prefix with the 'Tag' constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.AttributeAddedEnd
member.summary: Constant to indicate the end of the name of an added attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.AttributeDeletedBegin
member.summary: Constant to indicate the start of the name of a deleted attribute. When using, prefix with the 'Tag' constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.AttributeDeletedEnd
member.summary: Constant to indicate the end of the name of a deleted attribute.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.NodeAdded
member.summary: Constant to indicate an additional node (and its attributes and children). When using, prefix with the 'Tag' constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.NodeDeleted
member.summary: Constant to indicate a deleted node (and its attributes and children). When using, prefix with the 'Tag' constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.TextAddedBegin
member.summary: Constant to indicate the start of the added text, e.g., the value of an added node value, or comments. When using, prefix with the 'Tag' constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.TextAddedEnd
member.summary: Constant to indicate the end of the added text, e.g., value of an added node value, or comments.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.TextDeletedBegin
member.summary: Constant to indicate the start of the value of a deleted node value. When using, prefix with the 'Tag' constant.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.TextDeletedEnd
member.summary: Constant to indicate the end of the value of a deleted node value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.TextMovedFromBegin
member.summary: CharData, Comment, or Text moved from this position, when using append the OperationId number.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Difference.TextMovedToBegin
member.summary: CharData, Comment, or Text moved to this position, when using append the OperationId number.

member.name: T:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.Indent
member.summary: Class to contains all constants used to set the indentation of output text

member.name: T:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor
member.summary: Class to associate an operation identification number (which is the key to a hashtable), and the type of the data changes to a list of nodes which identifies the location of the change.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.operationId
member.summary: Change operation identifer, used to indicate the from/to changes in the position of data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.operationType
member.summary: The type of change in data.
member.example: Move, Prefix change, and Namespace change

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.nodeList
member.summary: Declares a local copy of a list of (baseline data?) nodes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.#ctor(System.Int32,Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.Type)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: Type of change in the data

member.name: T:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.Type
member.summary: Enumerator for the types of changes in the data.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.Type.Move
member.summary: The data was moved

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.Type.NamespaceChange
member.summary: The namespace data was changed

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.Type.PrefixChange
member.summary: The xml prefix was changed

member.name: P:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.OperationType
member.summary: Gets the type of change in the data.

member.name: P:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.OperationDescriptor.NodeList
member.summary: Gets the nodes which identify the location of the data change.

member.name: T:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath
member.summary: Class to provide lists of nodes and attributes based on proprietary alphanumeric path statements

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath.SelectNodes(Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewParentNode,Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewParentNode,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the list of nodes or attributes below the position indicated
member.param: The root node for the xml data
Proprietary path statement separator or character

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath.SelectAbsoluteNodes(Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewParentNode,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a list of node objects corresponding to the proprietary path reference provided.
member.param: Absolute path reference to node of interest

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath.SelectAllAttributes(Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewElement)
member.summary: Gets a list of the attributes for the specifed node and if applicable, its children.
member.param: The node which contains the attributes

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath.SelectAttributes(Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewElement,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a list of attribute objects based on the location specified.
member.param: Node at which to start the path search

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath.SelectAllChildren(Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewParentNode)
member.summary: Gets a list of all node objects at and below the location specified.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath.SelectChildNodes(Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewParentNode,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the list of child nodes below the position indicated
member.param: Position in the path statement at which to start collecting node objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath.ReadPosition(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets the numeric value at the specified position in the statement
member.param: Position at which to start the search
member.returns: Representation of the position in the absolute path to the node

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath.ReadAttrName(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the sub-string representing the attribute name which starts at the specified position in the provided statement and ends just before a vertical bar character or the end of the specifed statement.
member.param: Position at which to start the search

member.summary: Throws an 'invalid XmlDiffPath expression' exception.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffPath.OnNoMatchingNode(System.String)
member.summary: Throws an 'no matching node' exception.

member.summary: Add the DocumentType data to the output.
member.remarks: If the DOCTYPE declaration includes declarations that are to be combined with external files or the external subset, it uses the following syntax. DOCTYPE rootElement SYSTEM "URIreference" [declarations] or DOCTYPE rootElement PUBLIC "PublicIdentifier" "URIreference" [declarations]

member.summary: Holds the comparison data locally.

member.name: F:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.identicalData
member.summary: Holds the value which indicates the baseline and actual data are identical.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.#ctor(System.IO.MemoryStream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor
member.param: summary result if the comparison, value is 'true' if there were no differences found.

member.name: P:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.Identical
member.summary: Gets the value which indicates whether differences were found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.Peek
member.summary: Reads the next character without changing the state of the reader or the character source. Returns the next available character without actually reading it from the input stream.
member.returns: The next character to be read, or -1 if no more characters are available or the stream does not support seeking.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.Read(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a maximum of count characters from the current stream and writes the data to buffer, beginning at index.
member.returns: The number of characters that have been read. The number will be less than or equal to count, depending on whether the data is available within the stream. This method returns zero if called when no more characters are left to read.
member.param: The maximum number of characters to read. If the end of the stream is reached before count of characters is read into buffer, the current method returns.
When this method returns, contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count - 1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.
The place in buffer at which to begin writing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.Read
member.summary: Reads the next character from the input stream and advances the character position by one character.
member.returns: The next character from the input stream, or -1 if no more characters are available. The default implementation returns -1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.ReadBlock(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a maximum of count characters from the current stream and writes the data to buffer, beginning at index.
member.returns: The number of characters that have been read. The number will be less than or equal to count, depending on whether all input characters have been read.
member.param: The maximum number of characters to read.
When this method returns, this parameter contains the specified character array with the values between index and (index + count -1) replaced by the characters read from the current source.
The place in buffer at which to begin writing.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads a line of characters from the current stream and returns the data as a string.
member.returns: The next line from the input stream, or null if all characters have been read.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.ReadToEnd
member.summary: Reads all characters from the current position to the end of the TextReader and returns them as one string.
member.returns: A string containing all characters from the current position to the end of the TextReader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.XmlDiffPatch.XmlDiffViewResults.PopulateReader(System.IO.MemoryStream@)
member.summary: Returns the underlying populated basestream of a TextWriter objectdata as a TextReader object re-positioned to the beginning of the data stream.
member.param: reference to the data in memory
